Weekly Period

Source: R/utils_dates.R
weekly_period.Rd

These functions handle calculations related to weekly periods, which are typically used for reporting purposes. A weekly period is defined as a period of seven days.

The following functions are defined:

  • get_weekly_period(): Returns the start and end dates of the weekly period.

  • get_weekly_period_start_date(): Returns the start date of the weekly period.

There is no need for a function to calculate the end date of the weekly period, as it is simply the "as of" date.

Usage

get_weekly_period(as_of_date = Sys.Date())

get_weekly_period_start_date(as_of_date = Sys.Date())

Arguments

as_of_date

Date to use as the reference point for deriving other dates from. Defaults to the current system date.

Value

  • get_weekly_period(): A list containing the start and end dates of the weekly period.

  • get_weekly_period_start_date(): The start date of the weekly period.

See also

leasing_week, date_formatting

Other Date Utilities: date_formatting, get_weeks_left_to_lease(), leasing_period, leasing_week, month_dates, pre_lease_season, utils_dates

Examples

get_weekly_period()
get_weekly_period_start_date()
